sentences.en: Female pandas ovulate only once a year, in the spring.
sentences.cn: 一年雌熊猫仅仅在春天排卵.

sentences.en: Gonadotropins are used to induce follicular development and ovulation in women who do not ovulate.
sentences.cn: 促性腺激素用于不排卵妇女的诱导卵泡发育和排卵.

sentences.en: Some girls may first ovulate even before they menstruate.
sentences.cn: 有些女孩初次排卵可能甚至早于她们的月经。

sentences.en: Some women ovulate irregularly because their pituitary glands secrete too much prolactin.
sentences.cn: 有些不规则排卵的患者垂体腺分泌过多催乳素.

sentences.en: Women ovulate about once every month.
sentences.cn: 妇女大约每月排卵一次.

sentences.en: Women who do not ovulate regularly have difficulty in becoming pregnant.
sentences.cn: 妇女排卵期不正常就不易受孕.

sentences.en: Your body makes more of an important hormone called progesterone after you ovulate.
sentences.cn: 排卵后身体分泌一种重要的激素即孕激素.

trans.tran_en: when a woman or female animal ovulates, she produces eggs inside her body
